intro: Roettlera lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf roettlera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to varying climatic conditions. Roettlera lanceolata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage.
